tum.dss.thesis.lsframework

Class EllipsoidMethodData

  • java.lang.Object
    • tum.dss.thesis.lsframework.AbstractMechanismData
      • tum.dss.thesis.lsframework.EllipsoidMethodData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, MechanismDataInterface

    public class EllipsoidMethodData
extends AbstractMechanismData
    Functions to handle the data used for the ellipsoid method, i.e. the mapping of different data structures.
    Author:
    Florian Stallmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

      • getInitialCenter

        public Vector<FloatingPoint> getInitialCenter()
        Gets initial center with wi,S=0 and z=1.

        See proof of lemma 3.4 paragraph 1 for explanation.

        Returns:
        vector with initial center.

      • getInitialCenter

        public Vector<FloatingPoint> getInitialCenter(int type)
        Gets initial center of given type.

        The original paper suggests to use wi,S=0 and z=1 as center. This method returns the center by given type. The following types are available:

        • 0: original center as defined above
        • 1: vector consisting of 0s
        • 2: vector consisting of 1s
        • 3: vector with wi,S=1 and z=0
        Parameters:
        type - type of center, either 0, 1 or 2 as defined above.
        Returns:
        vector with initial center.

      • getObjectiveValue

        public FloatingPoint getObjectiveValue(Vector<FloatingPoint> wz,
                                       double integrality_gap)
        Calculates objective value given current center.

        See proof of lemma 3.4 paragraph 2 for explanation.

        Parameters:
        wz - current center.
        integrality_gap - integrality gap of separation oracle.
        Returns:
        objective value.

      • updatePlayerValuation

        public void updatePlayerValuation(Vector<FloatingPoint> wz)
        Updates player valuations with given wz vector and monotonize valuations.

        Using:

        • Claim 3.2: handle negative valuations by setting w+ = max(w,0)
        • Claim 3.3: set valuation to monotone version of w+ (performed in AbstractPlayer.setValuation(int, double))
        Parameters:
        wz - current center.

      • addIntegerSolution

        public boolean addIntegerSolution(int[] int_sol,
                                  int iteration)
        Performs duplicate check and saves integer solution to xl.
        Parameters:
        int_sol - found and already translated integral solution.
        iteration - current ellipsoid iteration.
        Returns:
        true if solution has not been added before, otherwise false.

      • addManualIntegerSolutions

        public void addManualIntegerSolutions(boolean add_zero)
        Add all integer solutions manually that are valid either due to the packing property or because only a single assignment will be made.

        Example: Lets assume x* = (1 0.5 1 1). The packing property allows us to add xl = (1 0 1 1) as solution. Moreover, we can assign the single fractional solution and add xl = (0 1 0 0). The zero vector (0 0 0 0) can be added as it is always valid.

        Parameters:
        add_zero - true to add the zero vector as solution which is always valid.

      • getNumIntegerSolutions

        public int getNumIntegerSolutions()
        Gets the total number of found integer solutions.
        Returns:
        number of integer solutions.

      • getIntegerSolution

        public IntegerSolution getIntegerSolution(int i)
        Gets an integer solution by index.
        Parameters:
        i - index of solution.
        Returns:
        integer array of solution.

      • getDimension

        public int getDimension()
        Will always return the size of x*+1 = E.size+1 = wz.length.

        This method was introduced to avoid any confusions when iterating over different variables which actually have the same dimension. It should be preferred for all loops if possible.

        Returns:
        dimension

        Which player index belongs to index k in set E.

        Returns:
